topLevelComment.author: erica epperson
topLevelComment.text: I'm so thankful for these tutorials which teach me something every day. Very clear and logical explanations, thank you!  Also keeps up my spirits while looking for a web dev position ;)

replies.author: freeCodeCamp.org
replies.text: Now that I look back at this video, I should have just used join....  Yes, reduce is different from join in that reduce is a generic method for running over an array and combining results, vs join just concatenates all the contents of the array together with some delimiter.

topLevelComment.author: ashish2199
topLevelComment.text: Thanks for the vid. Expecting to see more of such vids.

topLevelComment.author: Sabrani
topLevelComment.text: How do you make code run as you write it and show errors or console logs in same line?

replies.author: freeCodeCamp.org
replies.text: Yup, I was using VS code with Quokka.js extension.

replies.author: Sheri Richardson
replies.text: He's using Visual Studio Code with the Quokka.js extension

replies.author: Breakpoint
replies.text: the editor is VS Code, but has some neat plugin I think
